How Far London To Paris Planning Your Trip

Dreaming of Paris from London? You're closer than you think! The direct distance between these iconic capitals is approximately 213 miles (344 kilometers). The beauty lies in the convenience: the Channel Tunnel makes the journey remarkably swift. Travelling by high-speed Eurostar train is the fastest option, whisking you from city centre to city centre in just over 2 hours. Driving via the tunnel or ferry takes longer, typically 6+ hours including check-in and crossing time. Flying is also an option, though airport transfers add significant time. Understanding this short distance opens up endless possibilities for spontaneous getaways or efficient business trips. Planning your London to Paris adventure? The journey is refreshingly short!

How Far London To Paris By Road

The direct road distance from London to Paris is approximately 280 miles (450 kilometers). This route involves driving to the English Channel coast, using either the Eurotunnel Le Shuttle service through the Channel Tunnel from Folkestone to Calais, or taking a ferry from Dover to Calais/Dunkirk.

Travel time by road typically ranges between 6 to 8 hours, depending heavily on traffic conditions in both London and Paris, the chosen crossing method (tunnel is faster), and the specific starting/ending points within each city. Delays at border controls or during the crossing itself can also affect the total journey duration.

How Far London To Paris By Train

London to Paris by train covers approximately 305 miles (491 kilometers). The journey connects the two capitals directly via the Channel Tunnel. Travel time averages 2 hours and 15 minutes on the fastest Eurostar services. Trains depart frequently from London St Pancras International, arriving at Paris Gare du Nord.

How Far London To Paris By Plane

The flight distance from London to Paris is approximately 214 miles (344 kilometres). This covers the direct air route between the two major European capitals.

A direct flight typically takes around 1 hour and 15 minutes in the air. However, total travel time including airport check-in, security, boarding, and potential delays can easily extend to 3-4 hours or more door-to-door.
